description:
100% remote job

Business Development Consultant | Outlier Jets | United States

Introduction:

We are expanding the Business Development team for our fast-growing private aviation company and are seeking the right person to become our next Business Development Consultant. With the definition of our name in mind we are looking for an Outlier – someone who stands apart from the crowd. Our clients trust us with their time, family, and business, and at Outlier we plan to welcome an invaluable team member to cultivate and onboard the next generation of Outlier clients.

Position Overview:

The Business Development Consultant plays a pivotal role within the sales team. The individual will support Outlier’s Sales Directors by engaging existing leads and undertaking strategic outbound prospecting to generate new sales opportunities. The individual will be supported by deep investment in sales enablement resources and marketing channels, as well as the guidance and mentorship of a senior sales leader. Opportunities to meet with C-Suite decision makers, travel to industry and affinity events, and build a strong foundation in sales make this fully remote role an ideal opportunity for the ambitious sales professional.

Responsibilities:
• Partner with Sales Directors and Sales Management to generate new leads and opportunities through cold calling, email solicitation, research, and engagement of existing prospects within Salesforce.
• Accurately document sales engagement in Salesforce and proactively manage follow-up effort, escalating top sales opportunities and shepherding clients through the sales cycle.
• Respond to written and oral inquiries by providing general information of all Outlier products, ranging from the industry’s leading Jet Card & Charter programs to a growing aircraft brokerage and advisory practice.
• Educate, consult, and advise prospects on the private aviation industry, its benefits for both business and leisure, and Outlier’s value proposition within the larger landscape.
• Qualify potential Outlier clients based on their travel needs and financial expectations.
• When appropriate, secure an in-person meeting or conference call with the Sales Director.
• Act as a business partner to your Sales Director, collaborating on creative strategies to grow Outlier’s client base and consult
• Consult on product development and business strategy.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree
• 2+ year sales experience preferred in customer service, sales, or other related fields
• Excellent oral and written communications skills
• Experience with Salesforce or other CRMs preferred
• Ability to build rapport with executive level prospects
• Ability to prioritize, multitask, and collaborate within Outlier’s flat sales organization
• Positive, organized, and professional demeanor

﻿Industry:
• Aviation
• Luxury Goods
• Hospitality
• Private Aviation
• Customer Service
